p: These iPSC-based tools and models will bring researchers closer to understanding the pathological mechanisms involved in PD. In addition, they are amenable for use in large scale compound and biologics screens to develop personalized treatments for patients. In parallel, many researchers are working on directly using iPSC in personalized cell therapies, by transplanting iPSC-derived DA neurons back into PD patients. Although this is beyond the scope of this review, other authors provide detailed overviews of this specific aspect of iPSC research [ 162, 163]. This technique, developed and recognized as promising in animal models [ 164, 165], is now being tested in several clinical trials. However, although cell therapies might significantly alleviate symptoms for a period of time, they may not be a definitive cure for the disease, given that PD is not limited to DA neuron loss [ 166]. Hence, generating faithful PD models is of utmost importance, to dissect the mechanisms of pathogenesis and design effective drugs to halt the progression of the disease.
